page.title: 16THE PENROSE ESTATE
page.content: Penrose Estate is owned by the National Trust, but Mr. and Mrs. Rogers, who live in the very old house, look after it. The house, and the gardens in which there are exotic plants and rhododendrons planted by the original owners, are not open to the public. There are many trees on the estate such as horsechestnut and sycamore. Work was carried out by the Manpower Services who made new seats and new walks through the woods. Penrose walk starts at Helston and finishes at Loe Pool two or three miles away, which is part of the estate. Many people enjoy the wild life and peacefulness of all seasons. Rare birds are known to migrate to the estate during winter. Sometimes horse trials are held in the grounds. It is a well known local attraction.
